Package com.api.hub.ai.starter

Interface Environment

All Superinterfaces:
MarkerConstants
All Known Implementing Classes:
EnvironmentLoader, StatelessEnvironmentHandler
public interface Environment extends MarkerConstants
The Environment interface defines the central contract for the AI-agent framework.

It serves as the main entry point through which agents interact with their operating context, including:

  • The current state of the environment (conversation, system, or workflow context)
  • User inputs (requests or responses)
  • An InputOutputHandler for communication between the agent and the user

Implementations of this interface are expected to coordinate agent behavior by interpreting the environment state and user input, and responding accordingly.

Typical agent usage: 


 Environment env = new MyAgentEnvironment();
 boolean continueInteraction = env.process(currentState, userInput, ioHandler);

This interface also extends MarkerConstants to support structured logging using predefined SLF4J markers for traceability and debugging.

  • Field Details

    • log

      static final org.slf4j.Logger log
      The logger instance for logging environment-level operations. Logs can be tagged with markers from MarkerConstants for context-specific tracing.

  • Method Details

    • process

      boolean process(EnvironmentState env, String userResponse, InputOutputHandler handler)
      Processes the current interaction in the agent environment.

      This method receives the current EnvironmentState, user input, and an input-output handler, and performs the necessary logic to update the environment or respond to the user.

      Parameters:
      env - The current environment state, representing the conversation/session/system context.
      userResponse - The user input or message to be processed.
      handler - The input-output handler the agent can use to communicate with the user.
      Returns:
      true if the interaction should continue (e.g., keep the session alive), false to terminate.

    • getEnvironment

      EnvironmentState getEnvironment(@NonNull @NonNull String envName, String id)
      Retrieves or initializes an EnvironmentState instance based on the given environment name and identifier.

      This allows the framework to support multiple environments (e.g., multi-session, multi-agent) and restore or maintain state between interactions.

      Parameters:
      envName - The name or type of the environment (e.g., "chat", "order-processing").
      id - An optional unique identifier to distinguish different sessions or agents (nullable).
      Returns:
      The environment state associated with the provided parameters.
